**Advance Notice to Vendors of Planned Procurement for Environmental Remediation of Victoria Island (Phase 3a), Ottawa, Ontario**

**Notice Reference:** PW-22-01017965
**Publication Date:** December 20, 2022

The National Capital Commission (NCC) is providing advance notice of an upcoming procurement opportunity for the environmental remediation of Victoria Island (Phase 3a) in Ottawa, Ontario.

**Description of the Procurement:**

The NCC is seeking a qualified environmental remediation contractor to complete a remediation program for the greenspace area west of Portage Bridge, north of Middle Street on Victoria Island. Services to be provided include:

* Excavation of overburden material and concrete foundations to intact bedrock surface
* Site reinstatement with clean backfill and placement of suitable topsoil and seed in landscaped areas
* Installation of new fencing on the west side of Victoria Island to limit access to the Bronson Channel and Timberslide Ravine

**Procurement Strategy:**

As part of Canada's commitment to support Indigenous communities, this procurement aims to provide socio-economic benefits to the Algonquin Nation. Interested contractors are encouraged to build an inclusive contracting team by contacting Algonquin Nation and/or Algonquin companies to discuss and/or secure their participation in the work.

**Evaluation Process:**

Bidding will consist of a technical qualification element to evaluate the capability/experience of the remediation contractors, followed by a best value evaluation based on total estimated price and Algonquin participation.

**Procurement Schedule:**

* Planned Posting Date: March 2023
* Planned Contract Award Date: Spring 2023
* Planned Remediation Period: Spring/Summer 2023
